modules.description: This module offers functions to define and modify rectangular padding configurations using a record structure with `top`, `right`, `bottom`, and `left` integer fields. It supports creating uniform padding, directional adjustments (e.g., vertical or horizontal), and precise corner/side combinations, such as setting left and right values independently via the `leftRight` function. These operations are particularly useful for layout systems requiring fine-grained spacing control, like UI rendering or document formatting.

This component provides operations to construct and manipulate margin records with individual or directional fields (horizontal, vertical, corners) using integer values. It centers around a record type with explicit top, right, bottom, and left integer fields, enabling precise layout adjustments. Common use cases include defining horizontal margins via paired values or setting opposing edges symmetrically in UI layout systems.

This module defines various border styles for boxes using predefined symbol sets, such as single, double, round, and bold borders. It provides a type `t` to select from built-in border styles or a custom symbol set. Functions allow retrieving the specific border symbols for rendering or styling text-based boxes with consistent visual frames.

This module structures text rendering with alignment, floating, and nested layouts, while its padding and margin submodules enable precise spacing control through directional and corner-specific adjustments. It supports key operations for creating and modifying box structures with customizable borders using predefined or custom symbol sets. You can generate complex text blocks with aligned content, floating elements, and styled borders, making it ideal for terminal UIs or formatted document output. The combination of padding, margin, and border APIs allows for fine-grained layout design, such as setting independent left and right padding or applying bold borders to nested boxes.
